document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Pachyprotasis pallidistigma species group (Hymenoptera: Tenthredinidae) from China, with descriptions of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Pachyprotasis pallidistigma species group (Hymenoptera: Tenthredinidae) from China, with descriptions of three new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of the
Pachyprotasis pallidistigma
group

subSubSection.paragraph: Note. Species unknown to the authors are given in brackets [].

paragraph.keyLead: 1 The entire under side of mesopleuron muddy yellow, without red; mesopleuron sometimes with a small black spot on upper part, or with a black stripe along the frontal seam of mesepimeron............................................... 2

- The upper half of mesopleuron red, lower half white; ventral side of mesepisternum, mesepimeron black. Range. China (Tibet)..........................................................................[
P. pleurochroma
Malaise, 1945
]

2 Hind legs muddy yellow, apex black, outer side of coxa and femur sometimes with complete black stripe, without red; hind tibia black or with complete black stripe; outer side of trochanter without black spot (if outer side of hind trochanter with black spot, hind leg usually have black stripe along the entire outer side) (
Figs 1 –2
,
5– 34
)................................. 3

- Apex of hind femur, except for the extreme black apex, tibia and tarsomeres red brown; hind tibia without black stripe; outer side of trochanter with black spot ( Figs 3, 4 ). Range. China (Sichuan).............
P. daochengensis
Wei & Zhong, 2007
3 Mesoscutellum strongly elevated in lateral view ( Figs 35, 36 )................................................... 4

- Punctures on upper part of mesopisternum rather large and deep (
Fig. 39
); outer side of hind coxa with two black stripes (
Figs 1–2
). Range. China (Yunnan)................................................
P. bilineata Zhong & Wei
, sp. nov.

- Abdominal terga above black, each tergum with pale hind margin (
Figs 9 –10
,
19– 26
), or pale yellow, but each tergum with distinct black spot (
Figs 31–34
)............................................................................ 12
7 Flagellomere 1 as long as or longer than flagellomere 2 ....................................................... 8
8 Head with minute and shallow punctures; flagellomere 1 longer than flagellomere 2 ................................. 9

- Mesonotum muddy yellow, middle and lateral lobe each with a black liner spot ( Figs 15 , 17 ); the black spot on postocellar area small in female (
Fig. 64
), but rather large in male (
Fig. 65
). Range. China (Sichuan, Yunnan, Tibet); India ................................................................................................
P. pallens
Malaise, 1945
10 Hind tarsus black, base of each tarsomere maybe with pale brown ventral side in male ( Figs 14 , 28 )................... 11

- Hind tarsus 2–4 and basal half of tarsomere 5 white, sometimes apical 1 / 3 of tarsomere 3 black (
Fig. 30
). Range. China (Sichuan)................................................................
P. sichuanensis Zhong & Wei
, sp. nov.

11 Middle fovea extended to median ocellus; flagellum ventrally pale yellow in both sexes; base of each serrula distinctly elevated (Fig. 90 ). Range. China (Sichuan, Yunnan); otherwise northern Eurasia from Japan in the East to Great Britain in the West...................................................................
P. nigronotata
Kriechbaumer, 1874

- Middle fovea not extended to median ocellus; flagellum ventrally black in female (male unknown); base of each serrula flat (Fig. 95 ). Range. China (Hubei)..........................................
P. shennongjiai Zhong & Wei
, sp. nov.
12 Head and thorax sculptured; thorax with punctures.......................................................... 13

- Head smooth, practically without surface sculptures, but frontal area more or less coriaceous; thorax smooth, practically impunctate, when magnified
x 45
pronotum and mesepisternum feebly coriaceous. (according to
Takeuchi 1956
). Range. Russia (Kuriles).................................................................... [
P. elegans
Takeuchi, 1956
]

13 Abdominal terga black, each tergum with pale hind margin (
Figs 9 –10
,
19– 26
).................................... 14

- Abdominal terga muddy yellow, terga 2–8 each with a black central band (
Figs 31–34
). Range. China (Sichuan, Yunnan).................................................................................
P . zhoui
Wei & Zhong, 2007

14 Body length 7.5–10.5 mm ; hind leg pale without black stripe basally from the middle of femur in female, in male outer side of hind leg maybe with a black stripe along entire length........................................................ 15
15 Abdominal terga at least terga 1–5 with complete pale hind margin ( Figs 9 , 19 , 21, 23 )............................. 16

- Abdominal terga without pale hind margin, but along the middle part each with a row of pale equilateral triangle directed forwards (
Fig. 25
). Range. China (Sichuan), Myanmar , India .................................
P. s c a l a r i s
Malaise, 1945
17 Postocellar area about 1.25–1.5 times as broad as long ( Figs 66 , 68 )............................................ 18

- Postocellar area 2 times as broad as long (
Fig. 61
). Range. China (Gansu), Japan , India .....
P. longicornis
Jakowlew, 1891

18 Antenna ventrally pale; middle serrulae distinctly protruded, membrane between two serrulae shorter than width of a serrulae (Fig. 92 ). Range. China (Neimenggu, Gansu, Shaanxi, Ningxia)........................
P. pallidistigma
Malaise, 1931

- Antenna ventrally black; middle serrulae oblique, membrane between two serrulae longer than width of a serrulae (Fig. 93 ). Range. China (Gansu, Henan, Shaanxi, Ningxia, Hubei, Hunan).............................
P. qinlingica
Wei, 1998

19 Posterior part of each abdominal tergum with a broad triangular muddy yellow spot, anterior part reached to middle part of each tergum (
Fig. 21
); mesopleuron entirely muddy yellow without black (
Fig. 22
); penis valve as in
Fig. 105
.........................................................................................
P. pallidistigma
Malaise, 1931

- Posterior part of each abdominal tergum with a rather narrow triangular muddy yellow spot, anterior part not reached to middle part of each tergum (
Fig. 9
); mesopleural epimera with a black stripe along the frontal seam (
Fig. 10
); penis valve as in
Fig. 102
........................................................................
P. longicornis
Jakowlew, 1891
